title.value: Towards Causal Deep Learning for Vulnerability Detection
title.justification: The title of the paper clearly states the primary focus and approach used in this research.
title.quote: Towards Causal Deep Learning for Vulnerability Detection

extractions.description: This paper addresses the challenge of non-robust features in deep learning models used for vulnerability detection by incorporating causality. The approach, CausalVul, uses perturbations to discover and eliminate spurious features from a model's predictions and applies causal learning algorithms to improve accuracy, robustness, and generalization to out-of-distribution data.

type.justification: The research involves empirical studies through experiments and evaluations conducted on real-world datasets and models.
type.quote: Our approach consists of two phases. In the first phase, we worked on discovering the spurious features a model uses...we validated that the models indeed use certain variable names and API names as spurious features... We evaluated CausalVul using Devign [27] and Big-Vul [12], two real-world vulnerability detection datasets...

name.justification: The model proposed by the authors is referred to as CausalVul and focuses on addressing spurious features in deep learning models for vulnerability detection.
name.quote: Our approach CausalVul consists of two phases. First, we designed novel perturbations to discover spurious features that the model may use to make predictions. Second, we applied the causal learning algorithms, specifically, do-calculus, on top of existing deep learning models to systematically remove the use of spurious features and thus promote causal based prediction.

is_contributed.justification: The CausalVul model was designed and proposed by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: Our approach CausalVul consists of two phases.

is_executed.justification: The authors provided detailed experimental results and evaluations using the CausalVul model.
is_executed.quote: We evaluated CausalVul using Devign [27] and Big-Vul [12], two real-world vulnerability detection datasets and investigated on three SOTA models ‚Äì CodeBERT, GraphCodeBERT, and UnixCoder.

is_compared.justification: CausalVul was compared with state-of-the-art models in terms of accuracy, robustness, and generalization.
is_compared.quote: Our results show that CausalVul, when applied to models like CodeBERT, GraphCodeBERT, and UniXcoder, significantly improves accuracy, robustness, and generalization compared to their vanilla versions.
